@{557058:6ff86fcb-b7ab-44a5-b8a6-f6d9cae8b6e8} Thanks, I’ll work around this for now by not using the version in the Ubuntu package repository as suggested by @{557058:155a32e2-420c-4d50-98e0-0e722f63f906}   
  
But if it can’t be fixed, and this ticket has priority “minor” then perhaps the best “fix” would be to update the documentation with a warning to users trying to use the package from the debian repositories and then close this ticket as “won’t fix”.  
  
It’s odd that something which prevents the program from starting out of the box on Ubuntu when installed directly from Ubuntu is considered minor. Are the debian/ubuntu hosted packages officially deprecated? This might be important information in case IT departments care where packages are being installed from.  
  
I see the installation tutorials give the instructions to install from the osrf repository, but it does not appear to warn against using the version in the official packages, or give a post-install steps for those who do install from the Ubuntu packages.  
  
[http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install\_ubuntu&cat=install](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_ubuntu&cat=install)

content.html:
@Louise Poubel Thanks, I’ll work around this for now by not using the version in the Ubuntu package repository as suggested by @Jose Luis Rivero

But if it can’t be fixed, and this ticket has priority “minor” then perhaps the best “fix” would be to update the documentation with a warning to users trying to use the package from the debian repositories and then close this ticket as “won’t fix”.

It’s odd that something which prevents the program from starting out of the box on Ubuntu when installed directly from Ubuntu is considered minor. Are the debian/ubuntu hosted packages officially deprecated? This might be important information in case IT departments care where packages are being installed from.

I see the installation tutorials give the instructions to install from the osrf repository, but it does not appear to warn against using the version in the official packages, or give a post-install steps for those who do install from the Ubuntu packages.

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_ubuntu&cat=install

Install Gazebo using Ubuntu packages
